channel.title: A script that can
channel.description:
[glow=red,2,300]Can someone make a script that can click this for me please?[/glow]
[img]http://img54.imageshack.us/img54/2672/clickerni7.png[/img]
[glow=red,2,300]It changes the color that needs to be clicked and the positions move around.[/glow]

item.title: A script that can
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

[quote=“junkj, post:24, topic:55793”][quote author=gokon link=topic=79106.msg1083465#msg1083465 date=1175581610]
im not good at writing clean, neat, perfectly working scripts, so ill say basically what you need to do, someone else make it.

Program New; //basics by: gokon, final coding by:..... var wordorange, a, b, wordblack, c, d, wordblue, e, f, wordred, g, h, wordgreen, i, j, wordyellow, k, l, wordpurple, m, n :integer; const orange := ##### black := ##### blue := ##### red := ##### green := ##### yellow := ##### purple := ##### repeat if(findbitmap(wordorange, a, b))then begin if(findcolorspiral(orange, x1, y1, x2, y2))then clickmouse(x1+5, y1+5) end; if(findbitmap(wordblack, c, d))then begin if(findcolorspiral(black, x1, y1, x2, y2))then clickmouse(x1+5, y1+5) end; if(findbitmap(wordblue, e, f))then begin if(findcolorspiral(blue, x1, y1, x2, y2))then clickmouse(x1+5, y1+5) end; if(findbitmap(wordred, g, h))then begin if(findcolorspiral(red, x1, y1, x2, y2))then clickmouse(x1+5, y1+5) end;if(findbitmap(wordgreen, i, j))then begin if(findcolorspiral(green, x1, y1, x2, y2))then clickmouse(x1+5, y1+5) end;if(findbitmap(wordyellow, k, l))then begin if(findcolorspiral(yellow, x1, y1, x2, y2))then clickmouse(x1+5, y1+5) end;if(findbitmap(wordpurple, m, n))then begin if(findcolorspiral(purple, x1, y1, x2, y2))then clickmouse(x1+5, y1+5) end;
work off that.
[/quote]

Compile before you post,
And try using some standards.[/quote] its not supposed to work, stupid. all i put down was a basic framework. none of the numbers for colors, none of the coding for bitmaps. do that yourself. im on a mac right now and cant do any scripting actually in SCAR, so i have no way to compile it before posting it anyway. all i could do was was type it into the “code” tags. wanna know why im on a mac instead of windows? cause my dad&sister are in virginia for a college tour, and my mom just went down to pennsylvania cause the doctors called and said my grandpa should be dieing [i][u]today.

Read full topic

item.title: A script that can
item.dc:creator: @junkj junkj
item.description:
@junkj wrote:

Bitmaps are like a picture from string(pink letters)
ever seen random words and numbers like these things like this?=

bitmap :=FreeBitmap ‘asdjfhaaskdflashkldfhasklfashdsfkdashfkhasklf’+
‘sa12984127534jdnsklhf9dsugd9sut9jdhsgui49th45j4f98h329th389t5’+
‘ajdfhasjhf35hf8h3n2fdj329jdwhf932h9fnwejqkohr3rffbuiqwbhirehf84’

Thats a bitmap.
Bitmaps are useful for finding items, words and other stuff
You can do this by using a bitmap tool in SCAR.

So all you have do do is the take all the pictures of the words in the game that it wants you to find.

Read full topic

item.title: A script that can
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

[quote=“dudeofthed, post:6, topic:55793”][quote author=Robert92 link=topic=79106.msg1008182#msg1008182 date=1173796321]
Thank you[br][size=1]Posted on: February 12, 2007, 10:43:45 PM[/size][hr]Junkyj never did it can anyone else try it?
[/quote]

How about this script:

[code]program OrangeClicker;

var
BitmapName, x, y: Integer;

procedure LoadBmp;
begin
BitmapName := BitmapFromString(5, 4, ‘F68F90F09C56EEA232DA9’ +
‘110EFA029DC825DEC9538E18B1EE0852A9F4200DA8250FCA049FA’ +
‘9C3AF99943E68649F29069DE7B42F39442F9A02CE99130’);
end;

procedure FindColor;
begin
if(FindBitmap(BitmapName, x, y)) then
MoveMouseSmoothEX(x,y +random(0),20,40,45,25,30);
ClickMouse(x,y,True);
Wait(300)
end;

begin
repeat
LoadBmp;
FindColor;
Until(False)
end.[/code][/quote]
Ha it works. good Script.

Read full topic

item.title: A script that can
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

Robert92:

Thank you[br][size=1]Posted on: February 12, 2007, 10:43:45 PM[/size][hr]Junkyj never did it can anyone else try it?

How about this script:

[code]program OrangeClicker;

var
BitmapName, x, y: Integer;

procedure LoadBmp;
begin
BitmapName := BitmapFromString(5, 4, ‘F68F90F09C56EEA232DA9’ +
‘110EFA029DC825DEC9538E18B1EE0852A9F4200DA8250FCA049FA’ +
‘9C3AF99943E68649F29069DE7B42F39442F9A02CE99130’);
end;

procedure FindColor;
begin
if(FindBitmap(BitmapName, x, y)) then
MoveMouseSmoothEX(x,y +random(0),20,40,45,25,30);
ClickMouse(x,y,True);
Wait(300)
end;

begin
repeat
LoadBmp;
FindColor;
Until(False)
end.[/code]
